name: Kona Kai Resort & Gallery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want peace, romantic privacy, access to the bay side...fab gardens, serene pool, cordial and accommodating staff...this is the place. Boutique in all the best ways, as empty-nesters, we appreciate the no young children rule. This is a playground for us. Rooms, hold all you need...including silence...worth every penny...you will become return visitors...Enjoy!
reviews.title: A blissful surprise in paradise...Kona Kai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shop for a few essentials to stock the fridge, then check in to this secluded little resort. The grounds are georgeous, the staff is attentive, and the atmosphere is relaxed and languid. No bar, loud music at the pool, or bustling crowds to distract you from the breathtaking sunset on the dock. There's a tennis court and sea kayaks if you feel like you need some exercise, but we spent most of our time here soaking in the jaccuzzi, hanging out on the dock, or lounging together in the room. A very friendly and beautiful retreat from the local dive and bar scene. Although no food services on the premesis, there are many good restaurants, convenience stores, plus chocolate/ cigar/ sprits stores a short drive away. A boutique retreat, centrally located on Key Largo, but buffered from the road and neighboring properties (mostly older and not as upscale) by the botanical gardens.
reviews.title: peace and tranquility and a place to reconnect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Key Largo to snorkel and since it was the weekend of Hurricane Sandy that was not possible. Since my husband and i live only a couple of hours away in Palm Beach County being in Key Largo doesn't have the novelty and wow factor that it does for people coming from an entirely different region. Thank goodness we stayed at Kona Kai! Even though the winds were almost 30 mph and it was cold and you couldn't see anything in the ocean, the grounds were so beautiful, the rooms so comfortable and the staff so gracious that we had a good time anyway. It's really peaceful and the rooms have all the small amenities; real wine glasses, corkscrew, excellent coffee with ceramic mugs, lots of fluffy towels and great bath products etc. Since we really couldn't swim much in the ocean (the bay had big waves!) we were very appreciative of the pool which was heated and surrounded by beautiful gardens with a gorgeous view of the water. We saw lots of egrets and frigate birds and I saw a mantee in the bay. It was a great place to relax and be in beauty.
reviews.title: quiet little paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the most beautiful place we have ever stayed! The owners and staff are sooooo friendly and helpful!! Great, great people! If you go to the keys, you HAVE to stay here, hands down! Our next trip to the keys we are staying here the whole time! The botanical gardens were gorgeous! We got a personal tour of the grounds and plants and trees by their Ethnobotanist, he was very knowledgeable and friendly! It truly is a slice of Paradise! I miss them already!
reviews.title: WOW!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kona Kai Resort is our ultimate getway. When you get there you never want to leave. Kona Kai is on the bay side, so you get a beautiful sunset every evening. Sometimes you feel like you are the only one staying there, when you know you're not.
reviews.title: breathe, relax, renew
Absolutely amazing experience!!!
reviews.text: This was by far one of the best experiences we've had. From the moment we walked onto the property we were so well taken care of. Our every need was met and our expectations were exceeded. We were given exceptional resturant and site seeing recommendations and felt immediately welcome and pampered by all the staff. I made the decision to propose to my girlfriend at the resort and the staff immediately got on board to take pictures and make sure the moment was absolutely perfect. The size of the resort made for a very intimate experience with both the staff and my fiancé. The entire property was immaculate and very well taken care of. We reccommend Kona Kai to anyone and everyone and we will most definitely be back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is beautiful, very peacefull and quiet, away from the traffic noise of highway 1. Great place to relax and sunbathe whilst drinking fresh coconuts! Free water and fruit are provided near the pool and hot tub. There's also kayaks, tennis and shuffleboard if you get bored of lying on the private beach!! The room was very spacious with a huge bed and was extremely clean. I highly recommend a stay!
reviews.title: A little bit of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overpriced considering poor room service, which we were advised it would take place every other day until we requested daily bed making. Coffee pot was not clean the next day, and we had to request clean glasses the second day. We have stayed at fabulous bed and breakfasts (in reality small boutique hotels which compete to provide delicious breakfasts), but Kona Kai had no food service whatsoever on the property. Would be fine at half the price, however. Terrific garden but not a good value.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot think of another place that offers a similarly transformational experience. The natural beauty of the resort never fails to make me thankful that places like this exist. And I have yet to find resort staff that are so friendly and so focused on making guests feel like part of the family.
reviews.title: they aren't kidding - this place really is paradise

reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at Kona Kai several times a year for about a decade. I can't think of a better vacation spot for people who like each other.
reviews.title: Gets better and better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were one of the fortunate few to land at this beautiful oasis for a week. We found
reviews.title: What R you waiting for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ourselves transported to a paradise in December, unlike any other. Truly a jewel of the Keys...from its owners/employees who make it what it is, to the beautiful backdrop of nature - botanic gardens, on the water, gorgeous sunsets, etc. The staff is one of the amenities that is "top-notch". From the concierge who are so knowledgeable of the surroundings and make you feel right at home, to the friendliness and the little extras the housekeeping and other staff delivers. Not to mention the impeccable beauty of the gardens and the newly redecorated and furnished private suites nestled inconspicuously within the gardens. It was a "Garden of Eden" of sorts! We were there at an opportune time since the coconuts had just been harvested, and Rick, the ethnobotanist on staff, gave such an engaging tour of the gardens, and afterwards, we were able to experience and enjoy freshly tapped coconuts! If you are waiting for reassurance that this is the right resort for you...rest assured, along with relaxation, recreation, rejuvenation, refreshment...IT IS!! Reserve!
reviews.title: Nice place, beautiful grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably the best kept grounds in FL, a nice stop for friendly advice and accomodation in Key Largo. This setting is best suited for a couple that wants a quiet getaway and will spend most of the day on site. The price is high compared to surrounding resorts but what you get is a quiet stay and good advice. Definitely a good place to go if you have never been to this part of Florida.
reviews.title: THE Place to Stay in The Keys

reviews.text: We just returned from our fourth stay at Kona Kai. The resort is fantastic, and the staff is even better. Tracy and Denise understand customer service far better than most in the game. They will help you as much or as little as you like. It would be very difficult to be disappointed with any aspect of this resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful and private

reviews.text: This is a pricey resort, but it is worth it, in general. Small inconveniences are that the windows can't be opened (at least in the cottage where we stayed), and the water in the kitchen and bathroom sinks comes out in a trickle. That being said, everything else is just about perfect: the staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the setting is one of the most beautiful In which I have stayed: literally right on the water. The landscaping is very beautiful, too. There is free kayaking, paddleboating, tennis, and ping pong on the beach, in addition to swimming in the lovely pool for actvities. Overall, if you want to splurge, I say stay here.
reviews.title: One of the most pleasant stays I've ever enjoyed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A "resort" in the true "getaway" sense. If you want to relax in a beautiful setting on the bay (sunset) side; appreciate a friendly and attentive staff; and can be happy without lots of onsite activities and structure, then you will be happy here. If you need a place that serves you rum drinks or orchestrates conga lines, go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Practically perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for a week, in an attractive suite with a kitchen (utensils, dishes and pans provided) and private patio.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: Be sure to take Rick's garden tours. They will really add to your appreciation of the grounds.
reviews.title: What a wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reasons we found it only "practically" perfect:
reviews.title: ahhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --there was a noisy group a couple of nights at one of the neighboring resorts;
reviews.title: Loved it

aka: Kona Kai Resort & Gallery Hotel Key Largo
description: Owned and operated by the same family since 1991 and a "Fodor’s Choice" selection since 2009, Kona Kai is a magical hideaway, teeming with the natural beauty of old Key Largo and hand polished into one of the most exclusive resorts in the Florida Keys. With all new accommodations in 2013, Kona Kai is reserved for adults. Offering highly praised personalized concierge service, Kona Kai is regularly recommended by leading travel publications and websites. SInce the 2011 addition of "The Botanic Gardens at Kona Kai," guests enjoy our gardens day and night; complimentary tours for all registered guests are offered by our staff ethnobotanist. Kona Kai is a classic Keys experience; the perfect alternative if you're seeking to avoid the crowds and formality of a big resort.
